items.preText: Nathan: "@Arjun Devgan - you mean someone like Kane Williamson?"
items.text: the breakthrough! And Soumya has given it away. He'd looked so good until this point, but he's undone by an ugly hoick into the leg side. Henry aimed the ball nice and full and Soumya looked to target the leg side, but the ball rushed on to him, taking an inside edge and bouncing off the pad onto the stumps.
items.shortText: Henry to Soumya Sarkar, OUT

items.preText: Enter Shakib. And with him, Taylor and Guptill move back into slip.
items.text: and he's off the mark straight away with a tip-and-run single to mid off
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: Tuffey: "Damn, as soon as i was writing that this partnership should now lead til 100 runs and consolidate the things for BD - and Soumya dismissed"
items.text: full, and it's dug out back to the bowler
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: amlaan: "@liam "Always the bridesmaid, never the bride, ey. A bit of self belief would go a long way"...what is your say about southafrica ? i know you are not prepared for this question..:P" -- There's a deep, dark well that South Africa seem to fall into at World Cups. Cry, the South African male psyche
items.text: Tamim leans forward into a checked drive, left elbow held high, but his shot once again hits the field
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full, and Shakib's forward to drive, the shot pinging the field
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Gautam Shenoy: "To quote the famous singer Taher Shah, cricket without cricinfo is like "butterfly without fly""
items.text: forced off the back foot this time, but he can't get it past point
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: this one seemed to nip in off the seam, but it starts too straight and Shakib collects two with a flick through midwicket
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

items.preText: Luke Winslade: "Ummmm....has the commenter (Arjun Devgan) heard of Kane Williamson??? Or Ross Taylor? Kane is on par with Kohli and doesn't get to play most of his cricket on roads in the sub continent!"
items.text: definitely some nip off the seam this time, and it cramps Shakib for room as he's rooted to the crease
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Boult tests Shakib with a bouncer, and he rolls his wrists well in the stroke to control it, but can't find the requisite placement
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Shakib thrusts his bat out at a full one, the ball coming off the inside half of the stroke and rolling to mid on. There's just enough room for a quick single
items.shortText: Boult to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.preText: The Powerplay is done, and it's honours even, just about. No change in the bowling, yet
items.text: tapped softly to cover
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: Henry flings down a full, wide yorker, and Shakib likewise flings a drive out at it ... but ball zips under bat, and it's a dot
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: A. Sensarma: "Bangladesh are sensibly laying a platform in the initial overs, respecting the good balls which have been bowled. This is mature cricket we need to see from them. Soumya and Shakib need to play 'anchoring blinders', laying the platform for an end-overs assault from the likes of Mahmadullah, Mushfiqur and Mosaddek, reaching 350+ if your prediction favouring them needs to come true. Let's see!"
items.text: crunched out to deep point, and there's fifty up for Bangladesh
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, 2 runs

items.text: he's forward now, on the drive, but mid off is around in a flash to cut it off. Just the one
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: outside off, and chopped down to third man for a single
items.shortText: Henry to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: Paul Brown: "I cant figure Williamsons decision to bowl first after saving it looks a fresh wicket and then you remove all your slips after 3 overs using swing bowlers.?" -- To be fair, if there was going to be much in it for his quicks, it would probably be at the start of play. But they were probably hoping for a little more life out of, as you say, a fresh pitch
items.text: short and Shakib turns into a controlled pull out to deep square
items.shortText: Henry to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: and he starts with a waspish lifter outside off, Shakib dropping his hands as the ball buzzes past him
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.text: a better throw might have had him! Shakib clips a straighter one through midwicket, and he immediately wants two. Tamim doesn't! Boult runs across to field, but he's off balance as he throws and it's slightly wide, allowing Tamim to get home
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, 1 run

items.text: just short of a good length, and straight, Tamim hopping to defend
items.shortText: Ferguson to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.preText: Arun Raman: "@Luke: I remember seeing a stat on top 10 batting grounds around the world. No ground from the subcontinent was on the list. That said, Kane Williamson is a great batsman. Kohli is also a great batsman, let us not demean one to project the other."
items.text: Tamim throws his hands into a drive, and the bottom hand takes over a little too much, sending the ball rolling through mid on
items.shortText: Ferguson to Tamim Iqbal, 1 run

items.preText: avi: "@Luke Winslade...Thanks to espncricinfo query, I just checked the stats of both Kane Williamson and Virat Kohli outside Asian subcontinent. Kohli averages 57 with strike rate of 89. Kane averages 48 with strike rate of 82. Certainly, not at par!"
items.text: there's some width offered outside off, but Shakib chops it straight to gully
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Usman Nazir: "@agre with luke ... kane is a master act .. but still u cant let flat pitches take credit of kholis master class and brillance .. he is superior to any other batsmen in current era with out any doubt .. he has performed around the globe not only in subcontinent.. fan of kholi from Pak "
items.text: a bouncer to finish the over, Shakib buckling his knees to get underneath it
items.shortText: Ferguson to Shakib Al Hasan, no run

items.preText: Double change, de Grandhomme comes into the attack
items.text: and he's full to start, inviting the drive, but Tamim's shot is stopped by a driving cover fielder
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: full and straight from de Grandhomme, and Tamim taps softly to cover once again
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Tamim Iqbal, no run

items.text: Guptill at gully scoots across to stop an attempted glide to third man, another dot
items.shortText: de Grandhomme to Tamim Iqbal, no run
